intro: Russelia pubescens, commonly known as the velvet plant or silverleaf russelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its soft, velvety foliage and clusters of tubular, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, and thrives in well-drained soil with partial to full sunlight. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to red, bloom throughout the growing season, making it a popular ornamental plant. Russelia pubescens is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
